comment.author: 8409738@N08
comment._content: This is my photo of the same landing in 2007, this photo is taken from the cliff on the right looking straight across the bay. Little seems to have changed, a few less boats now.

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content: That's great to see Dan, thanks for sharing your photo.

comment.author: 8710082@N03
comment._content: Visited many a time added a large panoramic shot today.

comment.author: 72086415@N00
comment._content: The RNLI lifeboat was stationed here for many years. The slip way for that appears to be be still in postion at the front t of the 2007 photograph of Dan Photographic. When launched at low water  the boat had to be man handled over the beach using boards. As a boy in the 1950's I was fascinated by the lists of launches dating back to the 19th Century and the details of succesful rescues. The Flamborough lifeboat is now of a different type and stationed at South Landing and I understand a tractor and trailer are used in launching.
